intro: Phyllanthus diversifolius var. wightianus, commonly known as the Wight's bladder nut, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including India and Sri Lanka. It is a small shrub characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that vary in shape and size across different parts of the plant. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round, bladder-like fruits. This species is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
